questions.question_text:
Name the property under multiplication used in each of the following.
(i) -4/5 × 1 = 1 × (-4/5) = -4/5
(ii) -13/17 × (-2/7) = (-2/7) × (-13/17)
(iii) (-19/29) × (29/-19) = 1
hints: Recall properties: multiplicative identity, commutativity, multiplicative inverse
Check if numbers are being multiplied by 1, swapped, or giving product 1
Match each case to the appropriate property

questions.question_text: Tell what property allows you to compute 1/3 × (6 × 4/3) as (1/3 × 6) × 4/3.
hints: Look at how the grouping of multiplication changes
Recall properties involving grouping of operations
This property works for addition as well

questions.question_text: The product of two rational numbers is always a ___.
hints: Consider closure property for rational numbers
Recall if rational numbers are closed under multiplication
Check if product of two fractions is always a fraction
